original_title: No-Confidence motion against Keheliya in September
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The no-confidence motion against Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella will be debated during the first week of September.
Chief Opposition Whip Lakshman Kiriella told News 1st that the decision was reached during Friday (11) morning's party leader's meeting.
Recently, the Samagi Jana Balavegaya handed over the No-Confidence motion against Sri Lanka's Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella with 45 signatures.

The no-faith motion was moved against the Health Minister for irresponsibly allowing the inflow of substandard medicines, and medical equipment, for weakening the health sector, and contributing to the deaths of patients.
